page.title: 01Geography of Mattishall.
page.content: Mattishall and Mattishall Burgh are at the geographical centre of Norfolk, some four miles South East of East Dereham and twelve miles West of Norwich.A gentle plateau of boulder clay left by the glaciers in the Lowestoft advance of the ice about three hundred thousand years ago is the geological basis on which the two parishes developed.The soils on this plateau vary so that parts of Mattishall Burgh lie on sands whereas most of Mattishall is on heavier, stickier clays.The low plateau falls gently to the main valley of the River Yare to its South and to the smaller valley of the River Tud to the North. The Mattishalls,with East Tuddenham to the East and Yaxham to the West,lie on this Southern slope of the Tud valley.
